description: Photos: Storm damages homes, snarls commute
title: Photos: Storm damages homes, snarls commute
title_page: Photos: Storm damages homes, snarls commute
text:
1 / 17
Homes in Coweta County were damaged but there were no injuries. BEN GRAY/AJC
2 / 17
Curtis Compton A top to a tree landed in the yard of Mike Richardson after a radar-confirmed tornado downed six trees around his home on John Rivers Road on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Richardson said "it felt like the Wizard of Oz. The funnel was right outside the window. It was surreal. I can’t believe the windows didn’t blow.” Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
3 / 17
Curtis Compton Mike Richardson, 47, checks on damage to his home after a radar-confirmed tornado downed six trees in his yard on John Rivers Road on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Richardson said "it felt like the Wizard of Oz. The funnel was right outside the window. It was surreal. I can’t believe the windows didn’t blow.” Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
4 / 17
Curtis Compton Mike Richardson, 47, checks on damage after a radar-confirmed tornado downed six trees in his yard and damaged his home on John Rivers Road on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Richardson said '“it felt like the Wizard of Oz. The funnel was right outside the window. It was surreal. I can’t believe the windows didn’t blow." Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
5 / 17
Curtis Compton A tow truck removes a vehicle that was smashed by a downed tree during a radar confirmed tornado on John Rivers Road on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
6 / 17
Curtis Compton Greystone Power Corp. employees work to restore the power on John Rivers Road after a radar confirmed tornado on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
7 / 17
Curtis Compton Greystone Power Corp. employees work to restore the power on John Rivers Road after a radar confirmed tornado on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
8 / 17
A tornado was spotted at Highway 74 and I-85 north of the Palmetto-Tyrone area Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015. Channel 2 Action News Viewer photo
9 / 17
Homes in Coweta County were damaged but there were no injuries. BEN GRAY/AJC
10 / 17
This home on George Wynn Road in Coweta County was damaged by a tornado on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015. BEN GRAY/AJC
11 / 17
Channel 2 Action News This home on George Wynn Road in Coweta County was damaged by a tornado on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, Channel 2 Action News said. No injuries were reported. (Channel 2 Action News)
12 / 17
ccompton@ajc.com A vehicle sits abandoned by it’s occupants on John Rivers Road after a tree fell across it when storms swept through the area on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
13 / 17
ccompton@ajc.com A member of the Fulton County Fire Department warns homeowners to stay inside because of live wires on the ground after a storm swept through the Herdon Woods subdivision downing some trees and damaging some homes on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
14 / 17
ccompton@ajc.com A vehicle sits abandoned by it’s occupants on John Rivers Road after a tree fell across it when storms swept through the area on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
15 / 17
ccompton@ajc.com A member of the Fulton County Fire Department (left) checks damage and warns homeowners to stay inside because of live wires on the ground after a storm swept through the Herdon Woods subdivision downing some trees and damaging some homes on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, in Fairburn. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com
16 / 17
Channel 2 Action News Trees and power lines fell on Tell Road in Fairburn during a storm on Wednesday, Nov. 18, 2015, Channel 2 Action News reported. (Channel 2 Action News)
17 / 17
